019package org.jgrapes.mail;
020
021import java.util.HashSet;
022import java.util.Set;
023import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
024import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
025import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
026import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
027import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Subchannel.DefaultSubchannel;
030import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
031import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
032
033/**
034 * Provides a base class for mail components using connections.
035 *
036 * @param <O> the type of the open event
037 * @param <C> the type of the channel
038 */
039public abstract class MailConnectionManager<O extends Event<?>,
040        C extends MailConnectionManager<O, C>.AbstractMailChannel>
041        extends MailComponent {
042
043    protected final Set<AbstractMailChannel> channels = new HashSet<>();
044    private ExecutorService executorService;
045
046    /**
047     * Creates a new server using the given channel.
048     * 
049     * @param componentChannel the component's channel
050     */
051    public MailConnectionManager(Channel componentChannel) {
052        super(componentChannel);
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Sets an executor service to be used by the event pipelines
057     * that process the data from the network. Setting this
058     * to an executor service with a limited number of threads
059     * allows to control the maximum load from the network.
060     * 
061     * @param executorService the executorService to set
062     * @return the TCP connection manager for easy chaining
063     * @see Manager#newEventPipeline(ExecutorService)
064     */
065    public MailConnectionManager<O, C>
066            setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService) {
067        this.executorService = executorService;
068        return this;
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Returns the executor service.
073     *
074     * @return the executorService
075     */
076    public ExecutorService executorService() {
077        if (executorService == null) {
078            return Components.defaultExecutorService();
079        }
080        return executorService;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * If channels are event generators, register the component as
085     * generator upon the creation of the first channel and unregister
086     * it when closing the last one.  
087     *
088     * @return true, if channels generate
089     */
090    protected abstract boolean channelsGenerate();
091
092    /**
093     * Stops the thread that is associated with this dispatcher.
094     * 
095     * @param event the event
096     * @throws InterruptedException if the execution is interrupted
097     */
098    @Handler
099    public void onStop(Stop event) throws InterruptedException {
100        while (true) {
101            AbstractMailChannel channel;
102            synchronized (channels) {
103                var itr = channels.iterator();
104                if (!itr.hasNext()) {
105                    return;
106                }
107                channel = itr.next();
108            }
109            channel.close();
110        }
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * A sub-channel for mail connections.
115     */
116    protected abstract class AbstractMailChannel
117            extends DefaultSubchannel implements MailChannel {
118
119        private final EventPipeline downPipeline;
120        private final O openEvent;
121
122        /**
123         * Instantiates a new mail channel instance.
124         *
125         * @param event the main channel
126         */
127        public AbstractMailChannel(O event, Channel channel) {
128            super(channel);
129            synchronized (this) {
130                if (channels.isEmpty() && channelsGenerate()) {
131                    registerAsGenerator();
132                }
133                channels.add(this);
134            }
135            openEvent = event;
136            if (executorService == null) {
137                downPipeline = newEventPipeline();
138            } else {
139                downPipeline = newEventPipeline(executorService);
140            }
141        }
142
143        /**
144         * Close the channel.
145         */
146        public void close() {
147            synchronized (this) {
148                channels.remove(this);
149                if (channels.isEmpty() && channelsGenerate()) {
150                    unregisterAsGenerator();
151                }
152            }
153        }
154
155        /**
156         * Returns the event that caused this connection to be opened.
157         * 
158         * @return the event
159         */
160        public O openEvent() {
161            return openEvent;
162        }
163
164        /**
165         * Gets the down pipeline.
166         *
167         * @return the downPipeline
168         */
169        public EventPipeline downPipeline() {
170            return downPipeline;
171        }
172
173    }
174}
